column18: Annual fertility was calculated by multiplying average clutch size by average clutch frequency. We assumed that half of all eggs become female, and since only females were used in the model, fertility was halved so that fecundity rep-resents the number of females recruited into the population each year. Fertility was then multiplied by annual adult female survivorship, as adults must survive in order to reproduce, to give an estimate of annual fecundity.
